contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Unreferenced|date= October 2009}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Zygiella atrica'' | image = Zygiella.atrica.top.6927.jpg | image_caption = | image_width = 250px | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropoda]] | classis = [[Arachnida]] | ordo = [[Araneae]] | familia = [[Araneidae]] | genus = ''[[Zygiella]]'' | species = '''''Z. atrica''''' | binomial = ''Zygiella atrica'' | binomial_authority = ([[Carl Ludwig Koch|C. L. Koch]]), 1845 | range_map = Distribution.zygiella.atrica.1.png | range_map_width = 250px }} '''''Zygiella atrica''''', like other ''Zygiella'' species, builds an [[spider web|orb web]] with two missing sectors, and a signalling thread in the center of those, leading to its hideout, whereas young spiders build a complete web. Unlike ''[[Zygiella x-notata|Z. x-notata]]'', this spider is found away from houses, on bushes and rocky sites away from human habitation. It is also more brown. [[Image:Zygiella web.jpg|thumb|left|A typical web of a ''Zygiella'' spider.]] {{commons}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zygiella Atrica}} [[Category:Araneidae]] [[Category:Spiders of Europe]] [[Category:Animals described in 1845]] {{Araneidae-stub}}
